image.altText: Dr Dinesh Palipana

items.synopsis: The Liberal Party's candidate for the federal by-election in the seat of Fadden on the Gold Coast is set to be decided this afternoon.

title.children: Five hopefuls battle for preselection as the LNP's candidate for Fadden by-election in July

image.altText: a man leaning against a wall which holds a portrait of him wearing an army uniform

items.synopsis: Ben Roberts-Smith's loss is seen as a major win for Australian investigative journalism, with the Federal Court finding in favour of the substantial truth in the news articles about him.

title.children: The Ben Roberts-Smith defamation trial came down to one question

image.altText: a lived in camp site with pot-plant garden

items.synopsis: Australians without a home discuss where they bed down each night — and how they came to be there.

title.children: 'You wouldn't know they were homeless': Australia's hidden homeless, and where they bed down each night

image.altText: A fleece being thrown in the air.

items.synopsis: Want to know which sheep mob your woollen clothes came from? Thanks to these new electronic sheep ear tags, you might soon be able to.

title.children: What if a sheep's ear tag meant you could track your woolly jumper right back to the source?

image.altText: A mug shot of a man with dark hair, brown eyes and dark complexion.

items.synopsis: Queensland Police and Corrective Services are searching for a prisoner who has escaped from Rockhampton Hospital still wearing a leg iron and handcuffs.

title.children: Search underway for prisoner escaped from Rockhampton Hospital

image.altText: A drone view shows derailed coaches after two passenger trains collided in Balasore district.

items.synopsis: In one of India's worst rail accidents in years, the Coromandel Express, which runs from Kolkata to Chennai, collides with another passenger train, the Howrah Superfast Express.

title.children: Indian train crash death toll jumps to 280, injures hundreds more

image.altText: saltflats from the air, showing a small stream winding through mud, with trees growing on the side

items.synopsis: A Far North Queensland community with deep connections to water is seeing the streams and seasons change, and with it, their food and cultural security.

title.children: Changing seasons and streams: Kowanyama elders sound alarm on climate change

image.altText: black and white photo shows three women in uniform looking backwards and they walk up a dirt driveway

items.synopsis: In a suburban Brisbane garage, young women decoded radio transmissions that changed the course of World War II. For the first time, their top-secret work on a panicked Japanese cable about a new type of weapon can be revealed.

title.children: The top-secret WWII cable from a panicked Japanese officer that landed in a Brisbane garage — revealed for the first time

image.altText: Woman in an anxious pose on bed

items.synopsis: Navigating pain for women can be a twisted maze of questions, referrals and specialists, but amid the ever-growing list of diagnoses lies a silent condition that is experienced by many. It's called vaginismus.

title.children: The under-reported, painful condition ruining sex for women

image.altText: A man in glasses with a large brown mark on one cheek

items.synopsis: Professor Dan Angus was being interviewed in a ABC News television story when a doctor he'd never met noticed a sinister spot on his face while watching from home.

title.children: When a doctor saw this image on TV, he sent a potentially life-saving email

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

items.synopsis: At the outset, Walter Sofronoff thought he would have to consider if charges should have been laid against Bruce Lehrmann. But when he asked anyone involved in the inquiry if they wanted to argue against the prosecution, you could hear a pin drop.

title.children: As the inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's trial wrapped up, it was clear the goalposts had shifted

image.altText: A silver gull, white with red legs, silver wings and black wing tips, looks out to sea while standing at the water's edge.

items.synopsis: Numbers of super smart seagulls are declining in Australia's largest citizen science project but researchers aren't sure if we've hit "peak gull" or the birds are outsmarting the survey.

title.children: Seagulls are disappearing from citizen science surveys, so where are they going?

image.altText: A woman with short dark hair and a bright green jumper smiles at the camera, she stands at a counter with an open book.

items.synopsis: In the age of online shopping, regional writers festivals are helping keep bricks-and-mortar bookshops alive and encouraging a new generation of authors and readers.

title.children: When Nene moved, she felt disconnected from her writing community. So she started her own festival

image.altText: Liz Broughton wars gloves as she holds a cardboard box with a mastodon tooth inside next to a prehistoric skull

items.synopsis: A woman taking a stroll on a California beach finds an ancient mastodon tooth sticking out of the sand. But then the fossil vanished, and it took a media blitz and a kind-hearted jogger to find it again.

title.children: Ancient mastodon tooth found by woman walking along California beach

image.altText: A silhouetted couple stand before a crowd of people with sparklers being waved in a blurry scene.

items.synopsis: Why does wedding gift etiquette elicit such strong feelings? And is there a "magic number" to help make the decision easier?

title.children: A bride complained she didn't get enough money in her 'wishing well'. The response was huge

image.altText: Close-up of man

items.synopsis: Swirling through the many issues raised by the Ben Roberts-Smith case are the complex problems of collective and individual responsibility – and the dangers in politics of wrapping yourself in the glory of military action, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The fallout after Ben Roberts-Smith case doesn't end with him

image.altText: A woman in a pink exercise gear hits a tennis ball at the French Open.

items.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka refused to do a post-match press conference after her match on Friday, to protect her mental health.

title.children: Two years after Naomi Osaka refused to face the media at the French Open, another star has done the same

image.altText: Animation of flyby of Europa by NASA's Europa Clipper

items.synopsis: The Europa Clipper spacecraft is going to travel 2.6 billion kilometres to Jupiter's moon. Your name could be aboard it.

title.children: NASA is sending a 'message in a bottle' towards Jupiter. Here's how to add your name to it

image.altText: Smoke rises from the ground as an aircraft dumbs fire retardant on a fire in Canada

items.synopsis: Some 10,000 residents in coastal Quebec were forced to evacuate homes as wildfires engulfed more Canadian provinces, in what is emerging as one of the worst starts to the country's forest fire season.

title.children: Wildfires force evacuations in Quebec as Halifax residents return to destroyed homes

image.altText: A woman with flaming light red hair spins on a stripper pole.

items.synopsis: In New Zealand, a collective of strip club dancers has moved a dispute with their employer out into the open to fight for protections for all gig workers.

title.children: Strip club dancers around the world look to NZ, where a group of women are fighting for change

image.altText: Chance of above median rainfall map

items.synopsis: It might not give you the forecast for a specific date months in advance but the BOM's long-range outlook can be a great tool for assessing your odds of sunshine and rain down the track. So how can you use it?

title.children: What are my odds of sunshine in three months? Here's what the BOM's long-range outlook can tell you

image.altText: An Australian female golfer lines up a shot at the LPGA Tour event in New Jersey.

items.synopsis: The Australian world number five climbs the leaderboard after a blistering 8-under-par 64 in the second round, with American Cheyenne Knight sharing top spot.

title.children: Minjee Lee shares lead at New Jersey LPGA Tour event

image.altText: A Ukrainian soldier covers his ears as he fires a mortar at Russian positions next to a burnt out car.

items.synopsis: Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin escalates his feud with top military brass, accusing pro-Moscow forces planting various explosive devices, including hundreds of anti-tank mines.

title.children: Wagner boss says Russian forces tried to blow up his men, China considers another peace mission

items.synopsis: Players and families at the centre of the Hawthorn cultural safety review have penned an open letter about their experience as they officially lodge a complaint with the Australian Human Rights Commission.

title.children: Cyril Rioli, other former Hawthorn players release open letter saying they were 'betrayed' by club

image.altText: A woman holds sheets of paper in an office.

items.synopsis: A few weeks ago when the prime minister announced funding for a "multipurpose stadium" in Hobart, some people claimed Utopia — a satirical show about government bureaucracy — had predicted the future. It's not the first time it's happened.

title.children: Celia Pacquola still amazed when Utopia predicts real-life bureaucratic absurdities

image.altText: An NRL player runs to his right and shapes to pass to a teammate on his outside.

items.synopsis: Round 14 continues across the Tasman with the Warriors and Dolphins meeting for the first time, before the Titans play the Rabbitohs, and the Sharks take on the Broncos. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Warriors face Dolphins in top-eight clash

image.altText: Five Port Adelaide AFL players celebrate a goal against Hawthorn.

items.synopsis: The Power rack up their highest half-time score in their lopsided encounter against the Power at Adelaide Oval. Later, the bottom-placed Eagles host the ladder-leading Magpies in Perth. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Power on track to thrash hapless Hawks

image.altText: Matchmakers Preeti and Heena

items.synopsis: Preeti and Heena run a matchmaking service in Sydney – and their services are in high demand, particularly among young men who want to settle down.

title.children: Meet Preeti and Heena – Indian matchmakers set on finding the love of your life

image.altText: Woodside's North Rankin gas processing platform off the Pilbara coast

items.synopsis: Senior executives from oil and gas giant Woodside travel to Karratha to meet with workers after the death of an employee on a gas platform off Western Australia's Pilbara coast.

title.children: Woodside executives fly to Karratha after death of worker on North Rankin gas platform

image.altText: 25-year-old Jasmine West walks her whippet Penny on a gravel path next to green grass and an agapanthus bush.

items.synopsis: Jasmine was already inside a hospital when she had a stroke aged 25, but she suffers the ongoing effects of delayed diagnosis and treatment common among young people with the condition.

title.children: As more young people suffer strokes, experts warn 'cognitive bias' can delay diagnosis and treatment

image.altText: A man cuddles up behind a woman sitting on a chair.

items.synopsis: The husband of a healthcare worker killed in a crash expresses his heartache, as the woman responsible is criticised for "not once shedding a tear" during her trial.

title.children: Husband mourns soulmate as driver receives immediate parole despite showing 'no remorse'
